description: Variation of Condition Application under Section 73A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 2 (Number of Pupils) of planning permission 01/03199/FUL (Demolition of existing factory and construction of three storey building including basement at rear for school purposes, and associated parking area. Minor elevational alterations to the existing 6th form centre.) for amending pupil capacity.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

decision_conditions: The maximum number of pupils enrolled at and attending the Sixth Form Centre at 3-5 Surbiton Crescent for the purposes of receiving full time education shall not exceed 500, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: In order to ensure pupil numbers are restricted in the interests of amenity.
The gradient of the proposed road or footway shall not exceed 1:12 at any point. Reason: In order to provide adequate access for persons with disabilities or push chairs.

The levels of buildings, roads, parking areas and pathways within the site shall only be in accordance with details which shall have previously been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before development is commenced. Reason: To ensure that the appearance and functioning of the development is satisfactory and to safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers.

The circulatory system located in the car park area shall only be used for pupil 'drop-offs' in the morning period only and not for 'pick-ups' in the evening and shall be restricted for use by sixth form pupils only. Reason: To ensure the circulatory system does not become congested and result in cars backing up onto the public highway thereby causing a hazard to highway safety.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the cycle storage details approved under application ref: 02/12319/REM and retained permanently thereafter. Details of the proposed cycle storage for the provision of an additional 28 long-term and 2 short-term cycle parking spaces beyond the existing supply shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months from the date of this planning permission, and thereafter be retained on site. Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The facing materials to be used in the construction of the building shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the panel brickwork details approved under application ref: 02/03083/REM and retained permanently thereafter.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development.

Within 6 months of the date of this planning permission, a detailed landscaping scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented within the first planting season following the date of this planning permission and the tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for 5 years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. The landscaping scheme will include provision for the following new trees with specific locations agreed in writing by the local planning authority. 14-16 container grown stock: 1. 1no. - Prunus 'Hillieri Spire'2. 1no. - Gingko Biloba3. 1no. - Robinia Pseudoacacia 'Casque Rouge'4. 1no. - Liriodendron Tulipifera 'Fastigiata'5. 1no. - Tilia Cordata 'Greenspire'2-2.5m high:6. 1no. - Picea Pungens 'Hoopsii' Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced in the first available planting season, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose only. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 6 months of the date of this planning permission, details of the refuse storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities must be permanently retained at the site. All reasonable steps must be taken to ensure all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy SI17 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

That the proposed development be carried out and completed in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and any plan or drawing submitted with the application or subsequently submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority in compliance with any condition herein contained before any of the building(s) hereby permitted are occupied. Reason: To ensure that the proposed development will be carried out in its entirety as approved and so as to avoid any detriment to amenity by any works remaining uncompleted.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant details approved under application ref: 02/12246/REM and retained permanently thereafter.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties and the visual amenities of the area.

No flues or pipework, other than rainwater pipes, shall be fixed to the elevations other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved or in accordance with details which shall have first been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: In the interests of the visual amenities of the area.

No additional floorspace shall be formed within the buildings hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division or conversion of roof space to usable floorspace, and notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), no extension shall be erected without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority. Reason: The additional intensity of use would result in additional demand for car parking spaces which cannot be met on site.

The rating level of the noise emitted from plant located on the premises shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation. The noise levels shall be determined 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade. The measurements and assessments shall be made according to BS4142:1997. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties.

The external lighting shall be installed prior to the development being occupied and retained thereafter as approved under application ref: 02/12330/REM.Reason: in order that the lighting shall not cause nuisance to nearby occupiers or be a source of danger to road users.

Adequate access shall be provided for people with disabilities, in accordance with details which have been previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: In order that the proposed building is accessible to persons with disabilities and to comply with policies GG1 and S3 of the London Plan 2021.

Within 6 months of the date of this planning permission, evidence that active provision for electric vehicle charging points has been provided for 2 car parking spaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and thereafter retained. Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
site_name: 3-5 Surbiton CrescentKingston Upon ThamesKT1 2JP
